title: Erin Andrews is seeking $75M in damages from 2008 stalking
text:
Erin Andrews is seeking $75M in damages from 2008 stalking Mike Foss, USA TODAY 1:04 p.m. EDT October 16, 2015 TV personality Erin Andrews speaks onstage at the Nickelodeon Kids' Choice Sports Awards 2015 at UCLA's Pauley Pavilion on July 16, 2015 in Westwood, California. (Photo: Kevin Winter/Getty Images) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Erin Andrews filed a complaint against a Nashville Marriott following the conviction of a man who filmed the Fox Sports reporter through a front door peephole. That man, Michael David Barrett, was convicted of felony stalking and sentenced to 30 months in prison in early 2010. 
Andrews’ filed her complaint against Marriott International, West End Hotel Partners, Nashville Marriott at Vanderbilt University, and Barrett in 2011, arguing that those parties were guilty of negligence and invasion of privacy according to court documents obtained by The Smoking Gun . 
Her complaint goes on to claim that employees at Marriott revealed Andrews was a guest at their hotel, gave Barrett her room number and also granted his request to have the room next to hers. According to The Smoking Gun , the defense requested a specific damages amount, stating Andrews’ made “unreasonably vague and ambiguous” claims. 
The trial is scheduled to take place in February of next year. 
via The Smoking Gun : 
Witnesses include Chris Fowler, Craig James, and Jesse Palmer, prospective Andrews witnesses include several family members, agent Babette Perry, publicist Lewis Kay, and dancer Maksim Chmerkovskiy, with whom Andrews was paired when she was a “Dancing with the Stars” contestant in 2010. 
Since the 2008 incident, Andrews has replaced Pam Oliver as Fox’s top NFL sideline reporter in 2014 after her post game interview of Richard Sherman in the NFC Championship that year went viral.
